channel.title: Customization on icyphox
channel.description: Recent content in Customization on icyphox

item.title: Slice Of Life #2
item.description: HeyGuys Heh, posting frequency’s gone to shit, but meh. I write for myself. I mean, I’m genuinly surprised when some random Peruvian stumbles upon my blog and looks at it for a minute and thirty. Google Analytics, yeah. Anyway, a few new things. If you follow my Github, or happen to glance at it every once in a while, this site’s now on Github Pages! \o/ Not really \o/, since I don’t have that server that fs0ciety’d given me, but tbf, I wasn’t using it for anything else besides this website.

item.title: All My Rices
item.description: I thought you guys might be interested to see a few pictures of my actual working desktop. So here they are. Industrial Indoors Furniture Monochrome Synthwave I could go on, but I’ll save them for later. So that’s ricing for y’all. Stay tooned. (⊙_◎)

item.title: Ricing Your Linux Box
item.description: So this is my first post to do with Linux. And I’m going to talk about ricing. What’s ricing now? Is there a wheating too? I agree, that’s a super lame subheading, but whatever. So, ricing. It can be defined as the hipster version of customizing. Yeah, we all *nixers got sweg, yo. Doing anything to make your desktop look pretty. You can edit colorschemes in .Xresources, you can use conky and add a fancy looking system status HUD, you can use cava and have a music visualizer, right in your terminal, the possibilities are endless.
